result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clyde Michael Palmer

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

3:56 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Clyde Michael Palmer. Defendant Clyde Michael Palmer in court, in custody. Court reviews DE's bond motion. ADA Becker does not object. DE is serving probation sanction. Court amends bond. Adjourned: 3:59 PM. kma
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant's. Filed by Atty Dolfi.  Per RMW: please ask DA for input. Atty Dolfi requested hearing. JA scheduled. tfy/gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:01 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Attorney Aaron Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Clyde Michael Palmer. Defendant Clyde Michael Palmer in court, in custody. PD waives prelim. Office dismissed. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE pleads not guilty, waives speedy trial.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
